ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: There were no assigned coursework for this seminar.
A couple of hours to complete the readings

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I thought the EMD seminar this semester was fantastic - we had a great variety of different speakers coming to talk on a variety of different subjects, and they all illustrated very different ways to take the education of EMD forward into different jobs going forward.

Each seminar includes speakers presenting information related his/her expertise and area of study. Many of these topics focus on infectious diseases in the developing countries. Although it is understandable to have a desire to prevent diseases in poor, developing countries, some students are more interested in domestic issues and there should be a better balance between the topics presented.
This semester's speakers were much better than last semester! Definitely an engaging semester!
I liked the EMD seminar series- it provided me with insight as to the process of research, exciting Infectious Disease research under study and exposed me into the how research actually works.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely take this course - it provides great insight into how to apply the topics covered in EMD to real problems, and illustrates the wide array of problems that need the expertise of EMD. The lecturers were great on a whole, and always gave thoughtful, insightful discussions.
The EMD seminar series meets weekly where guest speakers present information related to their area of research study. The seminar is mandatory for EMDstudents.
i like it but it ends up being repetiive
The EMD Seminar Series provides EMD students with exposure to current research going on in the field and can help direct/guide students to experts in various Infectious Diseases.
